result.execSummary:
The defendant Alec T Kerwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence Credit granted for 11 days if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Cash bail to be refunded to poster.
CORRECTED 8/9/2016:  DNA SURCHARGE SHOULD BE $250.00.

Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To commence FORTHWITH.  First 75 days straight time.  Next 45 days Non-Working Hours with Standard Release Conditions.  Then remainder of Condition Time STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 90 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Day Report Center Discharge Notice dated August 1, 2015, defendant was discharged from the program on July 22, 2015
DRC Informational Court Report  (reviewed by Judge Ramirez on August 4, 2015)

Defendant Alec T Kerwin in court, in custody, with attorney James Edwin Gatzke.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld.  Credit for 11 days if revoked.
- 3 years Probation. 
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Buy money of $250.00 to be paid to Metro Drug Unit as a Condition of Probation as follows: $200.00 jointly and severally liable with E.S.; $50.00 solely liable
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week and obtain a sponsor.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

CONDITION TIME: 6 months - To commence FORTHWITH.  First 75 days straight time.  Next 45 days NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  Then remainder of condition time STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 90 days.
Sentencing hearing on January 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Alec T Kerwin in court with attorney James Edwin Gatzke.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducts preliminary hearing waiver colloquy.  Court conducts plea colloquy.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.  Court quashes warrant.  Court revokes bail.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
